snippet: A Chinese surveillance plane entered what Japan considers its airspace above disputed islands on Thursday, prompting the nations to exchange accusations.
abstract: Japan Defense Ministry says Chinese military surveillance plane entered its airspace near disputed islands in East China Sea, escalating already tense standoff over territory; ministry says plane's incursion is first known violation of Japanese airspace by Chinese plane in 50 years that it has been keeping records.

byline.contributor: Hisako Ueno contributed reporting from Tokyo, and Bree Feng and Jane Perlez from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: A Chinese surveillance plane entered what Japan considers its airspace above disputed islands on Thursday, prompting the nations to exchange accusations.

headline.seo: Japan Scrambles Jets in Islands Dispute With China
headline.main: Japan Scrambles Jets in Islands Dispute With China
headline.print_headline: Japan Scrambles Jets in Islands Dispute With China
